agentFrontend.description: This agent focuses on the front-end UI/UX aspects of the fellowship calendar application. It will handle rendering pages, styling, user interaction, and communicating with the backend through client-side fetches or Next.js server components. This agent is responsible for:

responsibilities.item: Maintaining reusable UI components and ensuring consistent styling (e.g., Obsidian dark mode aesthetic).
Implementing responsive layouts and accessibility best practices.
Coordinating route structure and navigation using Next.js App Router (including dynamic fellowship pages).
Managing client-side state for user actions (e.g., note editing, bookmark toggles), unless delegated to server components.
Providing user feedback through notifications, toasts, or loading/error states.
Collaborating with the backend agent to fetch or update data in Supabase.

deliverables.item: Next.js pages (e.g., /fellowships, /calendar, [slug]/page.tsx) with a polished UI.
Shared React components (e.g., FellowshipCard, NoteEditor, CalendarComponent).
A Shadcn UI + Tailwind-based dark mode design that is Obsidian-inspired.
Accessibility enhancements (proper ARIA labels, high-contrast text, keyboard-friendly controls).
